feed.title: ShinyTracker
feed.subtitle: Lists and displays detected changes on the RSI "Progress Tracker"

entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-09-14
entry.summary: Progress Tracker Delta 477 deliverables listed | 2022-08-17 => 2022-09-14 There were 62 modifications, 2 removals, and 1 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-09-14
entry.summary: There are currently 81 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 40 teams

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-07-06
entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-07-06 There are currently 66 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 27 teams 31 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 16 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 322 devs (out of ~512, or 63%) with 689 assignments scheduled to work on 66 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 6% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~65 devs (13%) scheduled for approximately 727 man-days. 36% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 9 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint: Chapter 01 Infiltrate/Defend Mission Laser Trip Mine Lean Over Cover Mantle T2 Personal Inventory Player Reflection RSI Lynx Space Mines Below are the time breakdowns for each team: Actor Feature Team44% part-time with 170 task(s) scheduled, 46% of which are for SQ42 Actor Tech Team34% part-time with 67 task(s) scheduled, 36% of which are for SQ42 Arena Commander Feature Team22% part-time with 36 task(s) scheduled, 50% of which are for SQ42 Audio26% part-time with 39 task(s) scheduled, 40% of which are for SQ42 Character Tech
